snippet: A reporter in France traces orphaned art, looted by the Nazis, to connect it to its rightful owners. A maze of information later, she has had some success.
abstract: Doreen Carvajal recounts difficulties she encountered in trying to find rightful heirs to a few of the more than 2,000 orphaned works of art which were looted or sold under murky circumstances during World War II and now reside in French museums awaiting claims of ownership.
lead_paragraph: A reporter in France traces orphaned art, looted by the Nazis, to connect it to its rightful owners. A maze of information later, she has had some success.

headline.seo: A Reporter in France Helps to Return Art Taken by the Nazis
